senses.de: To give permission for something to happen or someone to do something
senses.ex: My parents won't allow me to go to the party.

Tips.title: Seeking Permission
Tips.description: Used when someone needs to ask for approval before doing something.
Tips.example: You must allow me to pay for dinner since you invited me.

Tips.title: Parental Guidance
Tips.description: Commonly used by parents setting boundaries for their children.
Tips.example: My parents allow me one hour of video games a day.

senses.ex: The room is big enough to allow for a large table.

Tips.title: Spatial Planning
Tips.description: Refers to accounting for space or capacity when organizing or arranging.
Tips.example: We should allow space for a dance floor at the wedding.

Tips.title: Inclusion Acceptance
Tips.description: Indicates the acceptance or consideration of various possibilities or differences.
Tips.example: The club's rules allow members of all skill levels.

senses.ex: He doesn't allow that he made a mistake.

Tips.title: Accepting Reality
Tips.description: Highlights the acceptance or acknowledgment of facts or actions.
Tips.example: She won't allow that she lost the game fair and square.

Tips.title: Reluctant Admission
Tips.description: Used when someone hesitantly agrees or admits something, often after denial.
Tips.example: He finally allowed that he had been wrong.

senses.de: To take into consideration when making plans or calculations
senses.ex: You need to allow for delays when travelling.

Tips.title: Accounting for Uncertainty
Tips.description: Indicates accounting for factors that may vary or aren't guaranteed.
Tips.example: You should allow extra time for traffic during rush hour.

Tips.title: Considerate Planning
Tips.description: Emphasizes thoughtfully taking factors into account when making decisions.
Tips.example: The budget allows for unexpected expenses.

senses.de: To officially permit someone to have or do something
senses.ex: The law allows each citizen a vote.

Tips.title: Legal Permission
Tips.description: Used in contexts where rules or laws are involved in giving permission.
Tips.example: By law, the company allows employees to take breaks.

Tips.title: Rights and Privileges
Tips.description: Often associated with the granting of specific rights or privileges by authority.
Tips.example: The membership allows you access to the VIP lounge.

Admit.wordDefinition:
Admit is used when you acknowledge or confess something that you may not have wanted to reveal. For example, "I have to admit that I ate the last cookie." It implies a sense of guilt or wrongdoing.

Admit is used when you confess something and allow is used when you give someone permission.

Approve.wordDefinition:
The main difference between the words allow and approve is that allow means to give permission or to let something happen, while approve means to give official or formal permission or to express agreement or support for something.

For example, if your parents allow you to go to a party, it means they are giving you permission to attend. If your school or teacher approves of your project, it means they agree with it and you have their support.

Allow is used more informally and in everyday situations, while approve is used more formally and in official situations such as business, government or academic settings.

Authorize.wordDefinition:
Authorize means to officially give someone permission or power to do something. For example, one can say "The bank authorized me to withdraw money from my account.".

Both words refer to giving permission, but allow is more informal and authorize is more formal and official.

Allow can be used in everyday situations while authorize is usually used in legal or business contexts.

Consent.wordDefinition:
Consent has a similar meaning, but it's more formal and implies that someone has agreed to something after taking into account all the details.

For instance, if a patient consents to a medical operation, it means they agree to have it done after understanding the procedure, benefits and risks.

Both allow and consent are used in various situations where one party needs the approval or agreement of another party.

Enable.wordDefinition:
Enable means to give someone the means or ability to do something. For example, a computer program might enable a user to access certain features or functions.

Allow is about permission, while enable is about providing the necessary resources or tools.

Entitle.wordDefinition:
Entitle means to give someone the right to something, based on criteria or circumstances. For example, a student with good grades and attendance may be entitled to an award or scholarship.

Allow gives permission while entitle gives a right. Allow is applicable in situations where permission needs to be granted, while entitle is applicable in situations where someone deserves or qualifies for something.

Permit.wordDefinition:
Both words allow and permit have similar meanings and are almost interchangeable.

Permit is a more formal word that refers to an official or legal authorization to do or not do something. For example, a permit is often required to build a structure or operate a business.

To summarize, allow is more casual and can be used in everyday situations, while permit is more formal and often refers to official authorization.

Sanction.wordDefinition: Sanction means to authorize or approve something, often with legal or official consequences. It is applicable in more formal or serious situations, such as the sanctioning of a treaty or the imposition of economic sanctions against a country.

Tolerate.wordDefinition:
Tolerate means to accept or endure something or someone that you may not like or agree with. For example, a person may tolerate a loud neighbor or a coworker with different political views.

Allow is used when giving permission, while tolerate describes putting up with something or someone that you may not necessarily approve of.
